revised_title: A Further Examination of the Porcupine-Man and His Family
tldr: The author presents a case study of a man with a unique skin condition, known as the Porcupine-Man, and his family. Despite attempts to treat the condition, it appears to be hereditary, as all six of his children also have the same rugged covering. The author suggests that if such a family were to be forgotten, they might be considered a different species of mankind, raising questions about the origins of other differences among humans.
